data.question: What is the empirical formula of the synthesized material?
What crystal system does the synthesized material belong to?
At what temperature is the synthesized material thermally stable up to?
What is the space group of the synthesized material?
What is the cell volume of the synthesized material?
What is the calculated density (Dcalcd) of the synthesized material?
What is the quantum yield of the synthesized material?
What is the fluorescence lifetime of the synthesized material?
Does the synthesized material undergo structural changes upon desolvation?
data.answer: Yes, the synthesized material undergoes structural changes upon desolvation.

data.question: Is the fluorescence of the synthesized material sensitive to the presence and chemical nature of guest solvent molecules?
data.answer: Yes, the fluorescence of the synthesized material is sensitive to the presence and chemical nature of guest solvent molecules.

data.question: Does the synthesized material display metal−ligand or ligand−metal charge transfer bands in its fluorescence emission spectra?
data.answer: No, the synthesized material does not display metal−ligand or ligand−metal charge transfer bands in its fluorescence emission spectra.

data.question: What happens to the fluorescence intensity of the synthesized material upon complete desolvation?
data.answer: Upon complete desolvation, the fluorescence intensity of the synthesized material decreases by 10%.

data.question: Can the structural and fluorescence characteristics of the synthesized material be regenerated by exposure to DMF after desolvation?
data.answer: Yes, the structural and fluorescence characteristics of the synthesized material can be regenerated by exposure to DMF after desolvation.

data.question: What is the effect of water as a guest molecule on the structure of the synthesized material?
data.answer: Water as a guest molecule has a significant effect on the structure of the synthesized material, causing structural disorder.

data.question: Is the fluorescence lifetime of the synthesized material longer than those reported for other fluorescent MOFs?
data.answer: Yes, the fluorescence lifetime of the synthesized material is significantly longer than those reported for other fluorescent MOFs.

data.question: What is the role of DMF in the formation of the synthesized material?
data.answer: DMF plays a critical role in the formation of the synthesized material, influencing its structure and fluorescence characteristics.

data.question: Does the synthesized material maintain permanent microporosity after desolvation?
data.answer: Yes, the synthesized material maintains permanent microporosity after desolvation.

data.question: What is the BET surface area of the synthesized material?
Does the synthesized material exhibit linker-centered emission?
data.answer: Yes, the synthesized material exhibits linker-centered emission.

data.question: Is the emission of the synthesized material quenched by π−π interactions between the pyrene cores?
data.answer: No, the emission of the synthesized material is not quenched by π−π interactions between the pyrene cores due to their spatial separation.
